## Public Member Functions

### assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots() {#ad2f0da8ab6518a9d252876e7b996b10b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool AArch64FrameLowering::assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI, std::vector&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; &amp; CSI, unsigned &amp; MinCSFrameIndex, unsigned &amp; MaxCSFrameIndex) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots - Allows target to override spill slot assignment logic.

If implemented, <a href="#ad2f0da8ab6518a9d252876e7b996b10b">assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots()</a> should assign frame slots to all CSI entries and return true. If this method returns false, spill slots will be assigned using generic implementation. <a href="#ad2f0da8ab6518a9d252876e7b996b10b">assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots()</a> may add, delete or rearrange elements of CSI.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-h/#l00070">70</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-h">AArch64FrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-cpp/#l03922">3922</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-cpp">AArch64FrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### canUseAsPrologue() {#a2be9d35aaace9716441da5714f048af9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool AArch64FrameLowering::canUseAsPrologue (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> whether or not the given <code>MBB</code> can be used as a prologue for the target.

The prologue will be inserted first in this basic block. This method is used by the shrink-wrapping pass to decide if <code>MBB</code> will be correctly handled by the target. As soon as the target enable shrink-wrapping without overriding this method, we assume that each basic block is a valid prologue.

### determineCalleeSaves() {#ab041d0f79187663c0cc7c08cdf8227d0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void AArch64FrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-h/#l00076">76</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-h">AArch64FrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-cpp/#l03659">3659</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-cpp">AArch64FrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### orderFrameObjects() {#aa2b80c1201a1baeb6ee4466e970957ba}

The list of objects that we want to order is in <code>objectsToAllocate</code> as indices into the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a>. The array can be reordered in any way upon return. The contents of the array, however, may not be modified (i.e. only their order may be changed). By default, just maintain the original order.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool AArch64FrameLowering::restoreCalleeSavedRegisters (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mutablearrayref">MutableArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; CSI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
restoreCalleeSavedRegisters - Issues instruction(s) to restore all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of load instructions via loadRegToStackSlot().

If it returns true, and any of the registers in CSI is not restored, it sets the corresponding Restored flag in CSI to false. Returns false otherwise.
